body:
What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Summon Fume Spitter.
2. Click to sacrifice and add a -1/-1 counter to target creature. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected: all creatures (players, inc.) are highlighted green as available targets.
Actual: Only AI creatures are valid targets for -1/-1 counter. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? v1.1 on Windows 7-64bit.
author: [theogre...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/107114164438196306337/)
title: Fume Spitter's ability can not target player's creatures.

comments.body: That is due to the "Filter legal targets when appropriate" option that is enabled in preferences. This issue comes up quite frequently. Might need explanation in readme or somewhere else.
comments.author: [ubeefx](https://code.google.com/u/ubeefx/)

comments.body: Cheers for clearing that up. I thought it could be something as simple as that. Is having that on default?
comments.author: [theogre...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/107114164438196306337/)

comments.body: Yes, "Filter legal targets" is on by default. I guess one way around this is to make that option off by default. Another way may be to make the preference menu more obvious by promoting it to a top level menu instead of as a submenu of Arena so that it is more discoverable.
comments.author: [melvinzh...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/108278210804167927868/)

comments.body: Started a new issue to handle the underlying problem, see https://code.google.com/p/magarena/issues/detail?id=14
comments.author: [melvinzh...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/108278210804167927868/)
